thread.title: Kevin Durant drops 40 on former team as Warriors rout Thunder again
thread.title_full: Kevin Durant drops 40 on former team as Warriors rout Thunder again

author: AP
title: Kevin Durant drops 40 on former team as Warriors rout Thunder again
text:
Kevin Durant drops 40 on former team as Warriors rout Thunder again Kevin Durant dazzled Oklahoma City once again with a season-high 40 points in a 121-100 win. Post to Facebook Kevin Durant drops 40 on former team as Warriors rout Thunder again Kevin Durant dazzled Oklahoma City once again with a season-high 40 points in a 121-100 win.  //usat.ly/2k2sbN9   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Kevin Durant drops 40 on former team as Warriors rout Thunder again AP Published 1:12 a.m. ET Jan. 19, 2017 | Updated 43 minutes ago Kevin Durant is now 2-0 against his former team. (Photo: Kyle Terada, USA TODAY Sports) 
OAKLAND (AP) â€” Kevin Durant dazzled against his old team once again with a season-best 40 points, and the Golden State Warriors beat Oklahoma City 121-100 on Wednesday night despite Russell Westbrook's 21st triple-double for the Thunder. 
Westbrook had 27 points, 15 rebounds and 13 assists in an improved showing from his 20-point outing on 4-for-15 shooting when OKC first faced Durant in the other jersey here 2 1/2 months ago and watched him dismantle the Thunder from every which way. Afterward, Westbrook promised payback to Zaza Pachulia for a hard foul late in the first half. 
In his two games against OKC, Durant has scored 79 points on 28-for-40 shooting. He hit seven 3-pointers in the first meeting, a 122-96 Warriors rout Nov. 3 at Oracle Arena. Durant also had 12 rebounds Wednesday. 
Stephen Curry added 24 points and eight assists, and Klay Thompson had 14 points after he arrived back in the Bay Area just in time to play after a short absence dealing with a personal family matter. hdsportsclips: @Russwest44 forgets to dribble ðŸ˜‚ #Fail Comcast Sâ€¦ NBA Basketball: Thunder atâ€¦ https://t.co/oOrbrx8OKF pic.twitter.com/kQAcpI3tRW
